Articles.Content:
So, I was watching a 1.0.2 Twitch stream of JasonLii the other day, reentering an MK3 shuttle. It never experienced ANY reentry effects, and had periapsis below ground level by around 50,000 meters in altitude. This is ridiculous.

So a suggestion: Add a drag curve to parts, that changes their drag (and lift!) with altitude and speed. Especially for the MK3 parts, for the reason stated above.
Can you find his VOD and a timestamp?

There is already a drag curve in KSP.

Open the debug tools, click Physics, click DragProfile, edit.

![GZSAH3w.png](http://i.imgur.com/GZSAH3w.png)
